tophersmith.security.headers.impl

Class XXSSProtectionHeader

  • java.lang.Object
    • tophersmith.security.headers.impl.AbstractHeader
      • tophersmith.security.headers.impl.XXSSProtectionHeader

  • public class XXSSProtectionHeader
extends AbstractHeader
    The X-XSS-Protection header is used in response headers to require browser User Agents to enable reflective XSS protection. This defends the application against some XSS attacks.
    Author:
    Chris Smith

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      XXSSProtectionHeader()
      Constructs a new X-XSS-Protection Header object By default, builds X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block which enables the protection and requires the user agent to block attacks (rather than try to filter)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      XXSSProtectionHeader addReportURL(String url)
      Add (or replace) report URL.
      String buildHeaderValue()
      Constructs a String representation of the value of this header.
      XXSSProtectionHeader disableBlock()
      Disables mode=block protection
      XXSSProtectionHeader disableProtection()
      Turns X-XSS protection off
      XXSSProtectionHeader enableBlock()
      Enables mode=block protection
      XXSSProtectionHeader enableProtection()
      Turns X-XSS protection on
      void validate()
      The report URL, if set, must be valid and if protection is enabled but block or reporting is set

        getHeaderName

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

      • buildHeaderValue

        public String buildHeaderValue()
        Description copied from class: AbstractHeader
        Constructs a String representation of the value of this header. Does not validate.

              throws InvalidHeaderException
